p: The infusions were evaluated by the Ellman’s method, with some modifications ( Ellman et al., 1961). Sample solution (50 µl, 2 mg/ml) was mixed with 120 µl DTNB (0.3 mM, 5,5-dithio-bis(2-nitrobenzoic) acid) and AChE (0.026 U/ml, AChE from Electric eel), or BChE (0.026 U/ml, BChE from horse serum) solution (25 µl) in Tris-HCl buffer 50 mM (pH 8.0) in a 96-well microplate and incubated for 20 min at 37°C. The reaction was then initiated with the addition of 20 µl of ATCI (1.5 mM, acetylthiocholine iodide) or BTCl (1.5 mM, butyrylthiocholine chloride). A blank was prepared for all reaction reagents without enzymes solution. The absorbances were recorded at 405 nm for 30 min at 37 oC and the results were expressed as IC 50 values (concentration range from 0.05 to 25 µg/ml).
